intro: Erythrocephalum caudatum, commonly known as the redhead or redhead bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy pink to red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are arranged in dense, spherical clusters, making it a striking addition to gardens. Erythrocephalum caudatum is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
